bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 79 (Wednesday, May 10, 2023)][House][Pages H2246-H2247]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. SEWELL:H.R. 3201.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, section 8, clause 4 of the Constitution providesthat Congress shall have power to establish an uniform RuleofNaturalization.The single subject of this legislation is:The subject of this bill is limited to immigration andcitizenship.ADDITIONAL SPONSORSUnder clause 7 of rule XII, sponsors were added to public bills andresolutions, as follows:H.R. 12: Mr. Sablan.H.R. 38: Mr. C. Scott Franklin of Florida and Mr. Fulcher.H.R. 79: Mr. Crawford.H.R. 82: Mr. Aguilar, Mr. Jackson of North Carolina, Mr.Quigley, and Ms. Hageman.H.R. 133: Mr. Ferguson.H.R. 176: Mr. Mullin.H.R. 190: Mr. Yakym.H.R. 211: Mr. Rutherford.H.R. 309: Ms. Wilson of Florida.H.R. 310: Mr. Brecheen.H.R. 329: Mr. Gimenez.H.R. 331: Mr. Gottheimer.H.R. 339: Mr. LaLota.H.R. 354: Mr. Ogles.H.R. 374: Mr. Moore of Alabama.H.R. 396: Mr. Cardenas.H.R. 401: Mr. Donalds.H.R. 427: Mr. Fulcher.H.R. 428: Mr. Jackson of Texas.H.R. 452: Mr. Fulcher.H.R. 471: Mr. LaTurner.H.R. 472: Ms. Schrier.H.R. 541: Mr. C. dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
